headline: Sweet Chili Cocktail Meatballs
description: These cocktail meatballs celebrate the sweet-and-spicy flavors of sweet chili sauce.
recipeIngredient: 1 pound ground beef, preferably 80% lean (or 8 ounces each ground pork and ground beef)

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 375°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop 1/2 medium yellow onion and 2 garlic cloves. Place both in a large bowl. Add 1 pound ground beef, 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs, 1 large egg, 2 tablespoons sweet chili sauce, 1 tablespoon oyster sauce, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Mix together with your hands until evenly combined.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Using wet hands or a cookie scoop, portion the mixture into about 26 meatballs (about 1 1/2 tablespoons each). Roll each one between your hands to form a smooth ball. Place on the baking sheet, spacing them evenly apart.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, make the glaze: Place 3 tablespoons sweet chili sauce, 1 tablespoon ketchup, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon oyster sauce, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon honey, and 1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally. SImmer until slightly thickened and syrupy, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove the saucepan from the heat.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
recipeInstructions.text: Remove the meatballs from the oven and brush the meatballs with the glaze, using it all.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
recipeInstructions.text: Return the meatballs to the oven. Bake until cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes more. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds.

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: The meatballs can be made up to 2 days ahead and refrigerated in an airtight container. Reheat in a 350°F oven until warmed through, 5 to 10 minutes.Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days.

review.reviewBody: I don't know how long this recipe has been out there but I came across it yesterday and made it last night,  outstanding  !The exchanges I made were chili crisp  for  sweet chili sauce because I couldn't find sweet chili sauce at the store and I also traded out the catsup in the glaze for heinz chili sauce but that probably didn't make much difference. The change I will make next time  is adding an additional 1/2 lb. of ground chuck to make it a little more beefy.

I have made these meatballs three times in the past two months, once for a cocktail party.  Everyone loves them and they are eaten very quickly.  At home, I like to serve them with cauliflower rice and veggies.  I make the recipe as written except that I substitute Worcestershire sauce for the oyster sauce.  Thank you for this delicious meatball recipe.

name: Sweet Chili Cocktail Meatballs

author.name: James Park
author.description: James Park is a food content creator, food personality, and social media strategist based in Brooklyn. He was professionally trained at the International Culinary Center. He loves to share his love and passion for Korean cuisine and culture, fried chicken, and all things noodles. He’s currently working on his debut cookbook that’s all about chile crisp.
